text: *content.widgets* described here (<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/modules/export-to-template-context#retrieving-parameters-from-modules-already-rendered-on-the-template>) doesn’t work at all in global partials and in pages you need to edit the content of the module before the value is correctly pushed. It doesn’t render the default value.
Overridable=False doesn’t work in global partials, so there is no way to lock a module in a partial, like you can do in a template.
It isn't <https://github.com/HubSpot/jinjava/issues/374|built-in to hubl/jinjava yet>, but you can something like `{% set array = array[0:2] + ['these'] + array[3:] %}`
I think this is my problem in regards to my previous messages
is there no work around? its kind of disapointing
